causes: Failure of Stripper Feed Pump.
Blockage in the sour water feed line (FCV-2, FCV-3).
Complete failure of FCV-4 (Reflux control valve).
consequences: No sour water entering the stripper, leading to a shutdown of the process.
Build-up of H2S and NH3 in the sour water, potentially leading to corrosion and increased emissions.
Equipment damage due to lack of reflux and potential dryout of packing/trays.
safeguards: Level sensor 4 (monitors stripper level but does not directly prevent flow cessation).
recommendations: Implement low flow alarm on the sour water feed line.
Install a backup pump for the Stripper Feed Pump.
Include a high H2S concentration alarm in the sour water feed line.
Regular inspection and maintenance of the pumps and valves.

causes: Partial failure of Stripper Feed Pump.
Partial blockage in the sour water feed line.
Malfunction of FCV-2 or FCV-3 (partially closed).
Reduced steam flow (FCV-5 malfunction).
consequences: Reduced stripping efficiency, resulting in higher H2S and NH3 concentrations in the treated water.
Increased risk of corrosion in the downstream equipment.
Potential exceedance of emission limits for H2S and NH3.
Increased energy consumption due to sub-optimal operation.
recommendations: Implement low flow alarms on the sour water feed and steam lines.
Install flow meters on the sour water feed and steam lines for continuous monitoring.
Improve maintenance procedures to reduce blockages and improve valve operation.

causes: Failure of the level control loop on the Sour Water Stripper (LC-2).
Failure of the flow control valve FCV-2 or FCV-3 (fully open).
Malfunction of the Stripper Feed Pump (excessive flow).
Unexpected high flow from upstream
consequences: Flooding of the Sour Water Stripper, leading to reduced efficiency and carryover of H2S and NH3 into the treated water.
Potential overflow of the Sour Water Stripper sump.
Increased load on the Bottoms Pump.
safeguards: Level sensor 4 (initiates alarm on high level).
recommendations: Implement high flow alarms and shutdown on the sour water feed line.
Improve the level control loop on the Sour Water Stripper, adding a high level alarm with automatic shutdown and possibly interlocks.
Verify upstream process control mechanisms.

causes: Failure of a check valve (if present, although not explicitly mentioned in the documentation).
Incorrect piping configuration.
consequences: Contamination of the sour water feed with treated water.
recommendations: Verify piping and valve configurations.  If reverse flow is a possibility, add check valves on all relevant lines.
Regular inspection of all valves

causes: Leak in the sour water feed line causing mixing with another stream.
Unexpected stream interaction due to faulty valve operation.
Unintended opening of a normally closed valve.
consequences: Contamination of the sour water feed with other streams.
Potential equipment damage due to incompatibility.
recommendations: Implement leak detection systems on all lines.
Regular inspection and testing of valves to ensure proper operation.
Improve design to minimize chances of unintended interactions of streams.

causes: Increased steam flow (FCV-5 malfunction or higher demand).
Malfunction in the Stripper OVHD Condenser (reduced cooling).
Blockage in the condenser cooling water line.
consequences: Increased risk of thermal stress on the equipment.
Potential damage to the column packing/trays.
recommendations: Implement high-temperature alarms on the stripper.
Install a temperature control loop on the steam inlet.
Regular maintenance of the condenser.

causes: Reduced steam flow (FCV-5 malfunction or lower supply).
Malfunction of the Stripper OVHD Condenser (over-cooling).
Leak in the steam line.
consequences: Higher H2S and NH3 concentrations in the treated water.
recommendations: Implement low-temperature alarms on the stripper.
Improve insulation of the stripper and its associated piping.
Implement leak detection system on the steam line.

causes: Blockage in the overhead vent line.
Malfunction of PRV-2 (pressure relief valve).
consequences: Potential rupture of the Sour Water Stripper.
Release of H2S and NH3 to the atmosphere.
recommendations: Regular inspection and testing of the PRV.
Implement high-pressure alarms and shutdown.

causes: Leak in the Sour Water Stripper.
Vacuum condition in the stripper.
consequences: Potential ingress of air, compromising the integrity of the stripping process.
Equipment damage due to vacuum conditions.
recommendations: Implement low-pressure alarms and shutdown.
Regular inspection for leaks.

causes: Failure of Level Sensor 4.
Instrumentation error.
consequences: Potential for overfilling or running dry of the stripper.
recommendations: Install redundant level sensors.
Regular calibration and maintenance of level sensors.

causes: Failure of the level control loop (LC-2).
Malfunction of the Bottoms Pump.
consequences: Overflow of the Sour Water Stripper sump.
Potential release of H2S and NH3 to the atmosphere.
Increased load on the Bottoms Pump.
recommendations: Improve the level control loop, adding high level alarm and shutdown.
Install high level alarm with automatic shutdown.

causes: Failure of the level control loop (LC-2).
Malfunction of the Bottoms Pump.
consequences: Potential for the stripper to run dry.
recommendations: Improve the level control loop, adding low level alarm and shutdown.
Install low level alarm with automatic shutdown.

causes: Contamination of the sour water feed.
Unexpected chemical reactions.
recommendations: Implement compositional analysis of the feed water.
Regular cleaning and maintenance of the equipment.

causes: Contamination of the sour water feed.
Unexpected chemical reactions.
recommendations: Implement compositional analysis of the feed water.
Regular cleaning and maintenance of the equipment.

causes: Partial loss of a component in the feed.
Incomplete mixing of components.
recommendations: Improved mixing of the feed components.
Regular analysis of the feed composition.

causes: Unexpected phase separation within the column.
Temperature or pressure deviations.
recommendations: Improved temperature and pressure control.
Regular inspection of the column internals.

parameter: Flow (For all lines existing (reactant, product, purge, heating/cooling, vent, sampling, nitrogen etc.))
causes: Complete blockage in any of the lines.
Failure of any pump or valve.
recommendations: Implement comprehensive leak detection system.
Regular maintenance and inspection of all equipment.

parameter: Flow (For all lines existing (reactant, product, purge, heating/cooling, vent, sampling, nitrogen etc.))
causes: Rupture or failure in any line.
Valve malfunction.
recommendations: Implement high flow alarms and shutdown on all lines.
Regular maintenance of all equipment.

parameter: Flow (For all lines existing (reactant, product, purge, heating/cooling, vent, sampling, nitrogen etc.))
causes: Partial blockage in any line.
Valve malfunction.
Pump failure.
recommendations: Implement low flow alarms on all lines.
Regular maintenance of all equipment.

parameter: Flow (For all lines existing (reactant, product, purge, heating/cooling, vent, sampling, nitrogen etc.))
causes: Check valve failure (if present).
Piping error.
recommendations: Install check valves where necessary.
Regular inspection of all valves and piping.

causes: Unexpectedly high concentration of ammonia in the feed.
Improper neutralization of acidic components.
consequences: Environmental concerns related to high pH discharge.
recommendations: Continuous pH monitoring of feed and effluent streams.
Implementation of pH control system.

causes: Unexpectedly high concentration of H2S in the feed.
Leakage of acidic components into the system.
consequences: Environmental concerns related to low pH discharge.
recommendations: Continuous pH monitoring of feed and effluent streams.
Implementation of pH control system.

parameter: Utility supply (Water/ steam/oil/chilled water/ brine/ electricity)
causes: Steam supply failure.
Power outage.
consequences: Potential for hazardous conditions due to the presence of H2S.
recommendations: Redundant steam supply.
Emergency power generator.

parameter: Utility supply (Water/ steam/oil/chilled water/ brine/ electricity)
causes: Excessive steam supply.
Power surge.
recommendations: Implement high steam flow alarm and automatic shutdown.
Install surge protection devices.

parameter: Utility supply (Water/ steam/oil/chilled water/ brine/ electricity)
causes: Reduced steam supply.
Power failure.
recommendations: Implement low steam flow alarm.
Redundant steam supply.
